div.p: FORMS OF PRAYER FOR A FAMILY.
COMPOSED By the Late Pious and Learned John Worthington D. D.
PUBLISHED By the Right Reverend Father in God Edward, Lord Bishop of Gloucester.
LONDON, Printed for Luke Meredith, at the Star in St. Paul's Church-Yard, 1693.

div.head: TO THE READER.
div.p: THE following Prayers for a Family being hereafter to accompany the Scripture-Catechism, which I published soon after the Author's Decease; It was thereupon desired by some Friends that I would recommend these additional Prayers to you: And I could not but comply with their Request, though the Author's Name is sufficient to bespeak their Acceptance.

I gave a brief Character of that Excellent Person, in a Preface to
the Catechism: And the little that is there said (which I need not tell those that knew him, he highly deserved, and a great deal more) is abundantly enough to invite all good People to the perusing of any of his Writings.

And as to these Prayers, Whoever reads them, must needs judge them well fitted for the Vse of Families: The more so, for their being for Substance penned in the Words and Sentences of the divinely-inspir'd Writers, which are the aptest of any to excite Devotion; and in this Respect they have the Advantage of all the Prayers that I have seen.

This and other Instances of their Excellency and Usefulness,
I might here insist upon; but I think it wholly needless, they being easily to be discerned by a serious Reader.
I will add a few Words concerning the daily worshipping of God in our Families, which I cannot forbear, having this Opportunity.

This is a Duty very shamefully neglected in this loose Age. And no wonder it is so, by such as are irreligious, and can be content to live in gross Ignorance and the disacknowledgment of him in whom they live, move and have their Being. But that so many of those who are well instructed in Religon, and keep themselves from the more scandalous Pollutions of the
World, and make Conscience of attending on the Publick Worship of God, and of Secret Prayer, should be able to satisfy themselves constantly to Neglect Family-Worship, is very unaccountable: Especially since not only pious People in all Ages have so commended it by their Practice; but also, that nothing seems more clearly discoverable by Natural Light than that it is the paying of a most Reasonable Service; and nothing doth more plainly tend to the begetting, keeping up, and encreasing a sense of Religion in Families, than this doth.

In a Word, since the Divine Providence watcheth over Families as such, what serious Christian can doubt whether the Governours
of them are strictly obliged to call them every Day together; thankfully to acknowledge the daily care God takes of them, and the great Obligations he continually heaps upon them; to make a penitent Confession of their daily Offences against him, and to deprecate the Punishment deserved by them; and to put up humble Petitions to the Throne of Grace, for the Continuance of those Spiritual and Temporal Blessings they enjoy, and a Supply of those they want?

And that we may be more generally awakened to a Sense of this great Duty, as also that the following and all other good Helps for the better Performance thereof,
which pious Persons have given those who stand in need of them, may have the Divine Blessing accompanying them, is the Hearty Prayer of,

div.head: Morning-Prayer FOR A FAMILY.
I.
div.p:
EVER-Blessed Lord God, the God that hearest Prayers, and therefore should all Flesh come unto thee Ps. 65.2.; Thou who hast promised that where two or three are met together in thy Name, there thou wilt be in the midst of them Matth. 18.20.: We thy poor and unworthy Servants, who are less than the least of all thy Mercies Gen. 32.10., desire in all Humility to offer up unto thee this our Morning-Sacrifice of Praise and
Thanksgiving; we acknowledge, O Lord, that it is of thy Mercies that we are not consumed, because thy Compassions fail not, they are new every Morning Lam. 3.22.. Thou hast not dealt with us after our Sins, nor rewarded us according to our Iniquities Ps. 103 10.: But thou hast spared us according to the greatness of thy Mercy Nehem. 13 22., and kept us unto this present Moment: In thee we live and move and have our Being Acts 17.28., with all the comforts thereof: Thou, O Lord, hast preserved us from the dangers of the Night past, whereas we might have slept the Sleep of Death Ps. 13.3.; and thou hast raised us up to the Light of another Day, to walk before thee in the Land of the Living Ps. 116.9. Ps. 56 13.. What have we, O Lord, which we have not receiv'd of thee 1 Cor. 4.7.? The Mercies of this Life, the means of Grace, and the Helps and Advantages for that better Life which is to come; they are all from thee: And by these Mercies we should have been perswaded to offer up our
selves a Living Sacrifice, holy and acceptable unto thee, O God, which is our reasonable Service Rom. 12.1..

div.head: II.
div.p: BUT we confess, O Lord, that we have not rendered unto thee according to what we have received from thee 2. Chr. 32.25.: We have been unthankful, and have not glorified thee as God Rom. 1.21..
We confess, O Lord, we have sinned against thy Law written in our Hearts Rom. 2.15., and against the Light shining in our Consciences.
We have sinned against thy righteous Law, declared in thy Holy Word; whereas thy Word should have been a Lamp unto our Feet, and a Light unto our Paths Ps. 119.105..

We have sinned against the Light of the glorious Gospel of Christ 2 Cor. 4.4., against the Precepts and Promises of the Gospel; nor have we walked agreeably to that excellent Pattern of Holiness shining out therein, even the Life of Christ, who left us an Example, that we should follow his Steps 1 Pet. 2.21..
We have sinned, O Lord, against thy Mercies, and against thy Judgments and Corrections; against the Motions of thy Holy Spirit; against Purposes and Promises of better Service and Obedience.

Father, we have sinned against Heaven and in thy Sight, and have made our selves unworthy to be called thy Children Luke 15.21.: And therefore to us belongeth nothing but shame and confusion Dan. 9.8. of Face, and the Wrath to come 1 Thes. 1.10..

div.head: III.
div.p: BUT there is forgiveness with thee, O Lord Ps. 130.4.. To the Lord our God belong Mercies and Forgivenesses, though we have rebelled against him Dan. 9.9.. Thou hast declared thy self in thy Word to be the Lord, the Lord God, merciful, gracious, and long-suffering; forgiving Iniquity, Transgression and Sin Exod. 34.6.; not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to Repentance 2 Pet. 3.9.: Thou willest not the Death of Sinners, but hadst rather they should turn from their evil Ways and live Ezek. 33.11.: Thou didst so love the World, that thou gavest thine onely-begotten Son Jesus Christ; that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting Life John 3.16.: Thou didst send thy Son to be the Propitiation for our Sins, that we might live through him 1 John 4.9, 10..

div.head: IV.
div.p:
GOOD Lord, give us such a sight and sense of our Sins, as may beget in us an holy hatred of them, and that godly sorrow for them which worketh Repentance not to be repented of 2 Cor. 7.10.. Give us therefore to repent and turn to God, and do Works meet for repentance Acts 26 20.; and by repentance fit us for remission and pardon of sin. Lord, help our Unbelief Mark 9.24., and enable us by Faith to receive Christ as Prophet, Priest and King. Make us willing to be taught by him, and to obey him in all things Acts 3 22.. Enable us by Faith to embrace the Promises, and obey the Precepts of the Gospel. Bless us, O Lord, with all spiritual Blessings in Christ Eph. 1.3.. Bless us in forgiving our Iniquities Rom. 4.7.; and bless us in turning every one of us from our Iniquities Acts 3.26.. Wash us in the Blood of Jesus Christ, that Lamb of God which taketh away the Sins of the
World John 1.29.; and purge our Consciences from dead Works to serve thee the living God Heb. 9.14..

div.head: V.
div.p: AND let thy Holy Spirit sanctifie us wholly and throughout, in Spirit, Soul and Body 1 Thes. 5.23.. Let our Minds and Hearts be renewed more and more; that being transformed by the renewing of our Minds, we may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect Will of God Rom. 12.2.; that we may be enabled to know it as we ought to know 1 Cor. 8.2., and delight to do thy Will, O our God: And let thy Law be within our Hearts Psal. 40.8..

Give us so to know Christ and his Life, that he may be formed in our Hearts Gal. 4.19., and that he may live in us Ch. 2.20.; that the same Mind may be in
us which was in Christ Phil. 2.5., and that we may be in the World as he was in the World 1 John 4.17..

Give us so to know Christ and his Death and Sufferings, that we may be made conformable to his Death Phil. 3.10.; that we may feel the Virtue and Power of the Cross of Christ within us, in being crucified to the World, and having the World crucified unto us Gal. 6.14.; in crucifying the Flesh, with the Affections and Lusts thereof Gal. 5.24.; that the Body of Sin may be destroy'd, and that henceforth we may not serve Sin, nor obey it in the Lusts thereof Rom. 6.6..

Give us so to know Christ and the Power of his Resurrection Phil. 3.10., that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the Glory of the Father, so we also may walk in newness of life Rom. 6.4., and may mind and seek those things that are above, where Christ sitteth at the right-hand of God Col. 3.1, 2..
Let the Love of Christ constrain us, his Love in dying for us; and let us not live unto our selves, but unto him which died for us, and rose again 2 Cor. 5.14..

Enable us to walk worthy of the Gospel and the Grace of God; and, as we are taught thereby, to deny all Ungodliness and worldly Lusts, and to live soberly, righteously, and godlily in this present World Tit. 2.12..

Help us, O Lord, to consider our selves to be but Strangers and Pilgrims here on Earth Heb. 11.13. 1 Pet. 2.11., and to behave our selves as those that seek and desire a better Country, that is, an Heavenly Heb. 11.14, 16.. Let our Affections and Conversations be in Heaven Phil. 3.20., and make us meet for the Inheritance of the Saints in light Col. 1.12..

Give us, O Lord, to consider our latter end Deut. 32.29., and to prepare for it; and to work out our own Salvation with fear and trembling Phil 2.12.. So teach us to number our Days, that we
may apply our Hearts unto Wisdom Psal. 90.12..

div.head: VI.
div.p: KEEP and deliver us, O Lord, from the Lusts of the Flesh, the Lusts of the Eye, and the Pride of Life 1 Ioh. 2.16.; that no Temptation of worldly Pleasure, Profit, or Honour, may prevail over us: And enable us by thy Grace, to live a Life of Purity and Chastity, a Life of Temperance and Sobriety, a Life of Humility and Self-denial; help us to deny our selves, and to take up our Cross and follow Christ Matth. 16.24..

Keep and deliver us, O Lord, from all worldly Cares and Fears, from all discontent with our own estate, from
all distrust of Providence: And help us to sanctify thee in our Hearts, to make thee our fear and our dread 1 Pet. 3.15. Isai. 8.13.; help us to cast our Care and Burden upon thee 1 Pet. 5.7. Psal. 55.22., to commit our selves unto thee in well-doing as unto a faithful Creator 1 Pet. 4.19.. Prepare us for all disposals of thy Providence, and make all Things work together for good unto us Rom. 8.28..

Keep and deliver us from the temptations either of Prosperity or Adversity; that in fulness and prosperity our Hearts may not be lifted up and forget the Lord our God Deut. 8.14.; that in Adversity and time of Trial we may not forsake thee, nor murmur and repine against thee: But enable us to possess our Souls in Patience Luke 21.19., and to endure unto the end Matth. 24.13.: Make us to know both how to be abased, and how to abound, to do all Things, or to suffer all Things through Christ strengthening us Phil. 4.12..

Deliver us from all coveting, envying and grieving at the Good of
others, or from rejoicing at their Evils and Sufferings: And enable us to be content with our own Estate and Condition Heb. 13.5., and to love our Neighbour as our selves, and to do to others as we would they should do to us Matth. 7.12..

Deliver us from all bitterness, wrath and anger Ephes. 4.31., from all hatred and malice and desire of revenge: And give us to put on Bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of Mind, meekness, long-suffering Col. 3.12.; not rendring evil for evil unto any 1 Pet. 3.9. 1 Thes. 5.15., but over-coming evil with good Rom. 12.21..

Keep and deliver us, O Lord, from the wrath and craft of Satan and his wicked Instruments: Make us sober and watchful 1 Pet. 5.8. against temptations: Make us strong in the Power of thy might, that we putting on the whole Armour of God, may be able to stand against the wiles of the Devil Ephes. 6.10.. Thy Grace is sufficient for us 2 Cor. 12.9.; give us the victory over Satan, the World, and
the Flesh, and all those Lusts that would war against our Souls 1 Pet. 2.11..

Deliver us from all Blindness of Mind 2 Cor. 3.14., and from all Hardness of Heart Rom. 2.5.: And give us a right Understanding in all things 2 Tim. 2.7.. Enlighten thou the Eyes of our Mind Ephes. 1.18., and give us an Heart of Flesh Ezek. 11.1 • .: Put thy Laws into our Hearts, and write them in our Minds Heb. 10.16.; and put thy Fear into our Hearts, that we may not depart from thee Ier. 32.40..

div.head: VII.
div.p:
AND now, O Lord, who hast brought us to see the Light of another Day, lift thou up the light of thy
Countenance upon us Psal. 4.6., and watch over us for good Ier. 44.27.; keep and preserve us this Day from all Evil Psal. 121.7., from all Sin and Danger. Thou hast been our Helper, leave us not, nor forsake us, O God of our Salvation Psal. 27.9.. Preserve our going out and our coming in from this time forth and for evermore. Psal. 121.8..

Direct our Thoughts, our Words and Ways, that we may walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing Col. 1.10.. Give us Grace to walk circumspectly, redeeming the time, because the Days are evil Ephes. 5.15.. Enable us to keep our selves unspotted from the World Iames 1.27.. and herein to exercise our selves to have always a Conscience void of offence toward God and toward Men Acts 24.16..
Bless us in our Callings, in all lawful Endeavours and Employments.
Bless all that belong to us.

Bless all that are nearly related to us; let them be near unto thee, and find favour in thy sight. Be thou
their Refuge and Strength, a very present help in trouble Psal. 46.1.. Let them obtain Mercy, and find Grace to help in time of need Heb. 4.16..

div.head: VIII.
div.p: NEITHER are we mindful of our selves alone; but we beseech thee that thou would'st manifest thy Goodness and thy Power throughout the World.

Have mercy upon the Jews and all other Infidels. Bring in both Jews and Gentiles, that there may be one fold, as there is one Shepherd the Lord Jesus Christ, that good Shepherd John 10.16. who laid down his life for the Sheep ver. 15..

Give grace unto all those Nations that name the Name of Christ, to depart from all Iniquity 2 Tim. 2.19., and so
to live as becomes the Gospel of Christ Phil. 1.27..

Purge and purify all Christian Churches from all corruption of Doctrine and Life; and let the Doctrine and Truth which is according to Godliness 1 Tim. 6.3. Tit. 1.1., prevail more and more in the World against the spirit of Error 1 John 4.6. and all false Doctrine whatsoever.

Bless the Protestant reformed Churches with Peace among themselves 1 Thes. 5.13., Sanctify them through thy Truth John 17.17., make them sound and stedfast in the Faith Tit. 1.13. 1 Cor. 16.13., Defend and deliver them from the Oppressions of their Enemies. Save thy People, and bless thine Inheritance; govern them and lift them up for ever Psal. 28.9..

div.head: IX.
div.p:
IN mercy, O Lord, look down upon these Realms and Dominions.
Cause us to repent and to turn our selves from all our Transgressions; so Iniquity shall not be our ruin Ezek. 18.30.. Take away all our Iniquity, and receive us graciously Hos. 14.2.. Give us in this our Day to know the things that belong unto our Peace Luke 19.42..
Look down in mercy upon all from the highest to the lowest.
Establish the King's Throne in Righteousness Prov. 25.5.. Bless him in his Relations; in his Council.
Let the Judges judge the People with just Judgment Deut. 16 18..
Let Magistrates rule in the fear of God 2 Sam. 23.3..

Cloath thy Ministers with Righteousness Psal. 132.9., make them burning and shining Lights John 5.35.; thou who art the Lord of the Harvest, send forth faithful Labourers into thy Harvest Matth. 9.38..

div.head: X.
div.p: IN mercy look down upon all ranks and estates of Men. Visit the sick, strengthen the weak, pity the afflicted and remember them in their low estate Psal. 136.23.. Succour the tempted, heal the broken in spirit; and let those that sow in tears reap in joy Psal. 126.5.. Instruct the ignorant, and enlighten those that are in darkness. Convince and humble those that are presumptuous and secure, and give them repentance unto Life. Confirm and comfort the converted, and establish them in every good Word and Work 2 Thes. 2.17.; that they may be blameless and harmless, the Sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse Generation Phil. 2.15.; that they may be steadfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the Work of the Lord, as knowing that their Labour is not in vain in the Lord 1 Cor. 15.58..

div.head: XI.
div.p: THESE Mercies, and whatever else thou knowest to be needful for us or for others, we humbly beg of thee for the sake of thy dear Son and our Saviour Jesus Christ; in whose Name and Words we further call upon thee.

div.head: XII.
div.p: OUR Father which art in Heaven, Hallowed be thy Name, thy Kingdom come, thy Will be done in Earth as it is in Heaven: Give us this Day our daily Bread; And forgive us our Trespasses, as we forgive them that trespass against us; And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the Kingdom, and the Power, and the Glory, for ever. Amen.

div.head: I.
div.p:
MOST Holy and Glorious Lord God, Infinite in Goodness, and Wisdom, and Power; the Father of Mercies, and the God of all Comfort 2 Cor. 1.3.: We thy unworthy Creatures desire in all humility to offer up unto thee this our Evening Sacrifice of Praise for the Mercies of thy Providence over us this Day. Blessed be the Lord who daily loadeth us with his Benefits, even the God of
our Salvation Psal. 68.19.: Thou art Good, and doest Good Psal. 119.68..

Thou art unwearied in doing us Good; O let us never be weary in well-doing Gal. 6.9.: While we live let us praise thee, and sing Praises unto our God, while we have any being Psal. 146.2.. Let us praise and glorify thee in ordering our Conversation aright Psal. 50.23., in devoting our selves to thy Fear Psal. 119.38., and consecrating our lives to thy Service.

Thou art worthy O Lord, to receive Glory and Honour and Power; for thou hast created all things, and through thy Pleasure they are, and they were created Rev. 4.11.. Thou art worthy to be loved by us with all our Heart, with all our Mind, and with all our Strength Mark 12.30..

div.head: II.
div.p: BUT we confess, O Lord, we have not given thee the Glory due unto thy Name Psal. 96.8.: We have been Lovers of our own selves, and Lovers of Pleasures more than Lovers of God 2 Tim. 3.4.: We have loved this present World 2 Tim. 4.10., and the things that are in the World 1 John 2.15.. How have we wandered from thy Commandments Psal. 119.10., and walked contrary unto thee Levit. 26.21., in walking in the ways of our Heart, and in the sight of our Eyes Eccles. 11.9.: And therefore thou might'st walk contrary unto us, and make us feel that it is an evil and a bitter thing to have forsaken thee the Lord our God Ier. 2.19.: If thou, O Lord, shouldst mark our iniquities, we could not stand in thy sight Psal. 130.3..

div.head: III.
div.p: BUT with the Lord there is Mercy, and with him there is plenteous redemption Psal. 130.7.. Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath visited and redeemed his People Luke 1.68.: Who sent forth his Son, made of a Woman, made under the Law, to redeem them that were under the Law, from the curse thereof, that we might receive the adoption of Sons Gal. 4.4, 5. Ch. 3.13.. And Blessing, and Honour, and Glory be unto Jesus Christ, the Lamb of God, who was slain that he might redeem us unto God by his Blood Rev. 6.9, 13..

div.head: IV.
div.p:
WE beseech thee, O Lord, that thou wouldst fit us and prepare us more and more for that eternal Redemption, and the Benefits thereof, which Christ hath obtained for us Psal. 51.10.. Create in us clean Hearts, O God, and renew right Spirits within us Heb. 9.12..
Give us that broken Spirit, which thou wilt not despise Psal. 51.17.; that contrite and humble Spirit, which thou delightest to revive Isa. 57, 15.. Give us that repentance toward God, and Faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ Acts 20.21., as may fit us for pardon and peace, for Mercy and Grace; that in Christ we may have redemption through his Blood, even the forgiveness of Sins, according to the riches of thy Grace Eph. 1.7.. And give us Grace to live as the Redeemed of the Lord, and to walk worthy of Christ, who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all Iniquity, and purifie unto himself a peculiar People, zealous of good Works Tit 2.14.. We are not our own, but are bought with a price, even with the precious Blood of Christ; O let us therefore glorifie God in our Bodies, and in our Spirits, which are God's 1 Pet. 1.19. 1 Cor. 6.20..

div.head: V.
div.p:
FIT and prepare us also, O Lord, for the Influences of thy Light and Love: Make us meet to be living Habitations and Temples of thy Holy Spirit 1 Cor. 6.19. Ch. 3.17; and do thou delight to dwell in us 2 Cor. 6 16., and make thine abode with us John
• 4.23., and manifest thy self unto us Vers. 21..

Fit us for the guidance and the powerful assistances of thy Spirit, and fit us for the comforts of thy Spirit. Let us not grieve Ephes. 4.30., nor resist the Holy Ghost Acts 7.51.; but always follow thy good Spirit as our Guide, that we may enjoy thy Spirit as our Comforter John 14.26..

Let thy Grace always prevent us, and accompany us, and enable us to persevere unto the end. Make us, O Lord, perfect in every good Work, to do thy Will, working in us that which is well-pleasing in thy sight, through Jesus Christ Heb. 13.21..

Father of Mercies, O God the God of our Strength Psal. 43.2., and of our Salvation, never leave us nor forsake us: Our Eyes are unto thee, O God the Lord, in thee is our Trust, leave not our Souls destitute Psal. 141.8.. Let thy presence be with us, while we are here in this Wilderness; and lead us through it to the heavenly Canaan: Let us take heed of grieving or provoking thee through Disobedience or Unbelief Heb. 4.85.; but enable us by Faith in thy Goodness and Power, to resist and overcome our spiritual Enemies, Sin and Satan; enable us to follow the Lord fully Numb. 14.24., and to continue patiently in well-doing Rom. 2.7., that through Faith and Patience we may inherit the Promises, and enter into thy Rest Heb. 5.1.. Guide us, O Lord, with thy Counsel, and afterwards receive us to thy Glory Psal. 73.24..

div.head: VI.
div.p: AND now, O Heavenly Father, we recommend our Souls and Bodies unto thy Fatherly Care and Keeping this Night. Thou that neither slumberest nor sleepest Psal. 121.4., watch thou over us for good Ier. 44.27.: Preserve us from the Dangers and Fears of this Night; hide us under the safe shadow of thy Wings Psal. 17.8.: Refresh us with quiet Rest and Sleep: Let us lie down in peace Psal. 4.8., in thy Love and Favour; and raise us up in health of Body, and ability of Mind, to serve thee faithfully the next Day. Cause us to hear thy loving-kindness in the Morning, for in thee do we trust Psal. 143.8..

div.head: VII.
div.p:
MERCIFUL Father preserve all our Relations and Friends: Withhold
not thou thy tender Mercies from them, O Lord; let thy loving-kindness and thy truth continually preserve them Psal. 40.11.. Bless them with all spiritual Blessings in Christ Eph. 1.3.. Bless them with Health and Peace, with all the Necessaries of this life, and with Contentment; and give them all things that pertain to life and godliness 2 Pet. 1.3..

div.head: VIII.
div.p:
BE merciful, O Lord, unto all the Nations of the World that are without Christ Ephes. 2.12.. Send unto them able and faithful Ministers of the New Testament 2 Cor. 3.6., to open their eyes, and to turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan unto God Acts 26.18.. Make thy Son to be a light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of thy People Israel
Luke 2 32.; and let him be thy Salvation to the ends of the Earth Isa. 49 6.. Let the Earth be full
of the Knowledge of the Lord, as Waters cover the Sea Isa. 11.9.; and let all the Kingdoms of the World become the Kingdoms of our Lord and of his Christ Rev. 11.15..

Let those that enjoy the Light of the glorious Gospel of Christ 2 Cor. 4.4., walk as Children of Light Ephes. 5.8., and shew forth the Vertues and Praises of him who hath called them out of Darkness into his marvellous Light 1 Pet. 2.9..

Preserve thy little flock, and deliver the afflicted Churches of Christ out of all their troubles: Weaken the Power, and disappoint the Devices of their Enemies: Bless thy People with Peace Psal. 29.11.; and let all those that love thy Name, be joyful in thee Psal. 5.11..

div.head: IX.
div.p: HAVE mercy upon these Realms and Dominions. Turn thou us unto thee, O Lord, and we shall be turned Lam. 5.21.; Give us Grace throughly to amend our ways and our doings Ier. 7.5., and to bring forth Fruits meet for Repentance Matth. 3.8.; and do thou rejoyce over us to do us good Ier. 32.41.. Establish us in Truth, Righteousness and Peace.

Be merciful to all Orders and Degrees amongst us, from the King who is Supreme, to all subordinate Magistrates and Rulers; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable Life in all Godliness and Honesty 1 Tim. 2.2..
Let Judgment run down as Waters, and Righteousness as a mighty Stream Amos 5.24..

Let the Word of God run and be glorified 2 Thes. 3.1.; and let it appear to be the Power of God unto Salvation Rom. 1.16., in the turning of many Souls
from Sin to Righteousness and true Holiness.

div.head: X.
div.p: IN mercy remember all the Children of affliction. Be unto them the Father of Mercies, the God of Comfort 2 Cor. 1.3., and the God of their Salvation. Let Patience have its perfect work in them Iames 1.4.; and make all things, even afflictions, work together for good unto them Rom. 8.28..

div.head: XI.
div.p:
O LORD hear, O Lord, forgive, O Lord hearken and do Dan. 9.19. abundantly for us above all that we can ask or think Ephes. 3.20.. Answer us and accept us in the beloved Ephes. 1.6., thy dear Son Col. 1.13., Jesus Christ: To whom with
the Father and the Holy Spirit be all Praise, and Love, and Obedience, this Night and for evermore. Amen.

div.head: XII.
div.p: OUR Father which art in Heaven, Hallowed be thy Name, Thy Kingdom come, Thy Will be done in Earth as it is in Heaven: Give us this Day our daily Bread; And forgive us our Trespasses, as we forgive them that trespass against us; And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the Kingdom, and the Power, and the Glory, for ever and ever. Amen.

div.head: PRAYERS To be said Before the reading of the Holy Scriptures.
I.
div.p:
BLESSED Lord God, who alone canst teach us to profit Isa. 48.17., enlighten our Minds, and give us a good understanding in all things 2 Tim. 2.7.. Open our Hearts, that we may receive the love of the Truth 2 Thes. 2.10.. Enable us, O Lord, to receive the Word with meekness Iames 1.21., and with all readiness of mind Acts 17.11.; and to mingle it with Faith Heb. 4.2.. Let thy Holy Spirit (which thou hast promised to give to them that ask Luke 11.9.) enable us to know as we ought to know the
Holy Scriptures, which are able to make us wise unto Salvation; that we may thereby be throughly furnished unto all good Works 2 Tim. 3.15, 17.. Give us as new born Babes to desire the sincere Milk of the Word, that we may grow thereby 1 Pet. 2.2.; that we may grow in Grace, and in the Knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, to whom be Glory both now and for ever. Amen 2 Pet. 3.18..

div.head: II.
div.p:
O GOD, the Father of Lights, from whom comes every good and perfect Gift Iam. 1.17., Give us the Spirit of Wisdom and Knowledge Isai. 11.2., that the Eyes of our understanding being enlightened Eph. 1.18., we may know the Great Things of thy Law Hos. 8.12., and the Mysteries of the Gospel. Make us,
O Lord, to see and taste how gracious thou art Psal. 34.8. in thy Promises, which are exceeding great and precious 2 Pet. 1.4.; how holy in thy Precepts, which are all just and good. And let us not be Hearers only, but Doers of the Word, lest we deceive our own Souls Iames 1.22.. Let it be the Power of God unto our Salvation Rom. 1.16.. Enable us to walk as Children of Light, having no Communion with the Works of Darkness Eph. 5.8, 11.; to walk in the light, as thou art in the light 1 John 1.7.; that we may have fellowship with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ Ver. 3., and may be made meet to be Partakers of the Inheritance of the Saints in light Col. 1.12.; through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

div.head: I.
div.p: MOST gracious God, bless us, and all thy Mercies unto us: And make us thankful and obedient unto thee in all things, for Jesus Christ his sake. Amen.

div.head: II.
div.p: WE beseech thee, O Lord, to bless us; and these thy Creatures provided for us; that being refreshed and strengthened by them, we may live to the praise of thee, the God of all our Mercies and Comforts, and serve thy Will in our Generation, through Jesus Christ enabling us; to whom be glory and thanksgiving for evermore. Amen.

div.head: I.
div.p: BLESSED and praised be thy Holy Name, O Lord, for feeding our Bodies at this time: We beseech thee to feed and nourish our Souls unto everlasting Life, through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

div.head: II.
div.p: O GOD, the Father of Mercies, who hast refreshed our frail Bodies with thy good Creatures; blessed be thy Name for these and all thy Mercies, for thy Mercies to our Bodies and to our Souls. Enable us, O Lord, to return unto thee according to what we have received from thee: And bless us with all spiritual Blessings in Christ; to whom be all Praise, all Love, and all Obedience, now and for evermore. Amen.
